Description: Body sherd of pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora; very worn; exterior: undetermined black-figure decoration, much eroded; possibly wing of sphinx to left, with back of head; at top of sherd, touch of black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Difficult piece; the 'style' is reminiscent of the Attic Polos painter, but the details defy analysis in his oeuvre.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2084)
